title: Firefox account log-in confusion
content:
When I clicked Help in the menu today I came to this Support page, and I was able to login--but I must change the email I used today to something else. I cannot tell if this is a "Support' account or a "Firefox account" that would let me sync across three devices (Win 10, Win 11, iPad iOS 15.5). Please clarify.

If it is a new "Firefox account," how hard is it to change the email address? Will I lose data, bookmarks, etc?

Will the profile now on my desktop become worthless in terms of restoring Firefox if it crashes? Thanks.

title: Cant open firefox after Ubuntu update
content:
When I open Firefox through the GUI nothing happens. It acts as if I never tried to open it.

When I attempt to open it via the CLI I get:

joshua@joshua-Z390-AORUS-PRO-WIFI:~$ firefox /snap/firefox/1443/snap/command-chain/desktop-launch: line 52: /home/joshua/.config/user-dirs.dirs: Permission denied sed: can't read /home/joshua/.config/user-dirs.dirs: Permission denied /snap/firefox/1443/snap/command-chain/desktop-launch: line 261: /home/joshua/.config/user-dirs.dirs: Permission denied cp: cannot open '/home/joshua/.config/user-dirs.locale' for reading: Permission denied /snap/firefox/1443/snap/command-chain/desktop-launch: line 266: /home/joshua/.config/user-dirs.locale: Permission denied Error: cannot open display: :0


For context: Ubuntu: 22.04 LTS


The update that I ran was simply generic system updates through the app store. Notably though it was the snap store not the ubuntu software store. Don't know if that matters.


Any ideas? Thanks a million!
creator: joshuah143

title: Firefox asks me to download empty files with random names
content:
Hi guys,

My Firefox Nightly keeps asking me to download empty files with random names, e.g. ABC1234567.htm, they always have random letters and digits but the .htm extension is always the same. The files are always empty, 0 bytes. As far as I noticed, it happens when I navigate through pages, e.g. clicking on various buttons on sites or using the Back/Forward buttons on my mouse. I tried to lookup of what's the source of the files via F12->Network, but it did not show me anything related to this problem.

It happens on different websites even on the site coded by me, so that's definitely a browser/extension issue. I saw some posts mentioning this problem on Reddit but there were no solution/explanation.

Just now it asked me to download 3 different files in a row. I made a screenshot of this issue.

Firefox 103 Nightly, Win 10.
creator: koliarus1

title: Hard to read greyed txt everywhere window 7, 10 and Firefox
content:
Hello all, I have searched everywhere and tried all the suggestions but being a little visual challenged I have a terrible time viewing all this light grey txt I'm getting on the newer Firefox. Some versions back I could just install a windows classic theme that replaced everything and made txt easy to read, but today that theme no longer works due to Firefox updates. Yes I can use a High Contrast theme that helps some but it looks Butt Ugly and is annoying. I'm sure a lot of other folks are having this problem from all the messages I'm reading about the problem. Is there a sure way to get BLACK text on my screen? If not maybe it's time that Firefox gets an update that fixes this issue. I would appreciate any help you folks can give me. Regards, 

   Hreagle

title: Youtube non mi salva più la cronologia delle visualizzazioni
content:
Ciao, dopo aver effettuato una pulizia con Ccleaner, Youtube non mi salva più la cronologia. Non ho cambiato nulla nelle impostazioni e andandole a vedere in "Privacy e sicurezza" nemmeno Ccleaner le ha cambiate e ad un controllo risulta tutto a posto, "Elimina cookie e dati dei siti web alla chiusura di Firefox" non è appuntato. Di particolare c'è che nella pagina di Youtube in "Cronologia visualizzazioni" la prima voce di quelle sulla destra, quella con l'icona del cestino e la scritta in maiuscolo: "CANCELLA TUTTA LA CRONOLOGIA VISUALIZZAZIONI" risulta disattivata cioè, anche cliccandoci non succede nulla. (primo screenshot) Ci tenevo alle visualizzazioni preferite e, sinceramente non mi ricordavo :P che Ccleaner la cancellava, ma che poi in qualche modo la sospendesse inaspettatamente..

P.S. se non sono loggato a Google, sempre nella pagina di Youtube in "Cronologia visualizzazioni" appare questa scritta: "La cronologia delle ricerche e la cronologia delle visualizzazioni non sono disponibili a causa della tua attuale selezione dei cookie. Scopri di più su come gestire i tuoi cookie." (secondo screenshot) Non riesco a capire a che selezione dei cookie si riferisce. Grazie se mi risponderete :) Ciao
creator: galvanpaolo

title: Latest FF update ERASED ALL SAVED WEBPAGES AND FAVORITES
content:
Today, 6/10/22, I did what we sheep are trained to do, click on the latest update. What happened next is excruciatingly painful: EVERY SINGLE--ALL--FAVORITES AND SAVED PAGES--YEARS, YEARS WORTH OF SAVED PAGES AND FAVORITES, ERASED, GONE, WIPED OUT.

WHAT IS GOING ON? WAS THIS INTENTIONALLY PROGRAMMED? YEARS WORTH OF SAVED PAGES, GONE!!!

So I clicked on an excitingly named "restore" type link. Which resulted in only today's subsequent web activity being included.

What are you people doing?
